extendedIngredients.name: beef stock
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cups of beef stock . I've found beef stock gives the best flavor, but one time I made borscht with turkey stock and it worked really well.
extendedIngredients.originalName: beef stock . I've found beef stock gives the best flavor, but one time I made borscht with turkey stock and it worked really well
meta: with turkey stock and it worked really well.

extendedIngredients.name: dill
extendedIngredients.original: Optional: sour cream and fresh dill
extendedIngredients.originalName: Optional: sour cream and fresh dill

extendedIngredients.name: greens
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups of vegetables. I like to use carrots , celery, celery root , or cabbage. Braising greens are a good addition as well, but should be added during the last 10 or 15 minutes of cooking.
extendedIngredients.originalName: vegetables. I like to use carrots , celery, celery root , or cabbage. Braising greens are a good addition as well, but should be added during the last 10 or 15 minutes of cooking

extendedIngredients.name: ice cubes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large red beets, peeled. Depending on my mood, I'll either run these through the grater blade on my food processor, or I'll cut them in small cubes.

title: Borscht
summary: Borscht might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 372 calories, 42g of protein, and 16g of fat. This recipe serves 2 and costs $3.21 per serving. Head to the store and pick up cabbage. braising greens are an addition as, flour, wine vinegar, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the canolan oil you could follow this main course with the Cherry-Apricot Turnovers as a dessert. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour and 34 minutes. Not a lot of people really liked this Eastern European dish. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 61%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Borscht II, Borscht, and Borscht.
